text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that a lender's failure to make reasonable inquiries about occupiers can cause an overriding interest to bind them, even if it was not discovered. The candidate answer discusses actual occupation and overriding interests ('In many jurisdictions, if you were in actual occupation of the property at the time of the remortgage, your interest may be protected as an overriding interest regardless of registration'), but it does not explicitly state that the *failure to make reasonable inquiries* is what binds the lender, which is the specific focus of the criterion. It mentions inquiries generally but doesn't link the failure of inquiry directly to binding an undiscovered overriding interest.", "criterion_id": "94c14c26-3d41-4b09-abe3-a18f253ce007"}
